title: Fixed OnRestraintLock achievement events
body:
This bug was caused be providing the incorrect values to UnlockManager.AchievementEvent.

Side context: RestraintSet.Padlock is a string. so I had to convert it to the Padlocks item in order for unlock/stop achievement tracking to work.
author: NewBunnySmile

comments.body: prevPadlock.ToName() gets you the padlock name expected btw, you can use that instead of tryparse

The parse was the other direction tho. I had the string, I needed the right item from the Padlock enum however. RestraintSet.Padlock only has the padlock saved as a string so I needed to convert that into the right item in the Padlock enum
I am not used to working in languages that have extensions... Thanks to the tip on discord.

title: Adds all the DoW/DoM base classes to work with hardcore traits...
body:
I also changed Gladiator and Paladin to be more in line with one another.

Left out DoH/DoL classes but they have their ids put in a comment at the very end of the file. Should we need them at some point.
author: NewBunnySmile

comments.body: you mad lad you actually did it. GG ðŸŽŠ

And I might do it again an other time. I do think there is a better system available with a big enum. 

Potentionally adding DoH/DoL as I have most of the code structure generated as a big comment on the end of the file.

title: Puppeteer Alias Permissions Logic Implemented
body:
- Includes the support of alias request permissions for global permissions and pair puppeteer actions. 
- Implemented support for global puppeteer alias permissions and possibly pair puppeteers.
- Removes some superfluous validation logic for the HandleTextAction used by Alias's and triggers to dispatch the requests.
- Adds the configuration options and localization placeholders for the global options.
- Fixes a regression in the Puppeteer Trigger UI that previously prevented access to setting trigger and the setting the permissions from the puppeteer UI.

*Client side only*
Tested against live GS Web Service.
author: nia-saeli

title: Added UID info to /safeword and /safewordhardcore
body: I hope this is what you wanted. Just adds the info of the pair uid thing in the help message to isolate the given pair
author: NewBunnySmile

comments.body: can we move this from the helper info? This is just the text that shows up in the plugin menu. What I meant was to add it as a printed help text when invalid safeword format is provided. A structure for this is towards the bottom of the command manager, I think i have it print out command help text for invalid command format on other commands in there.
OK, I adjusted thing. Hopefully now they are more to your liking.

title: Fixes the UI restraints visibility bug with no perms...
body: I will say: I don't have enough pairs to check the fix myself. But given what I read. It should work the way it's supposed to work now.
author: NewBunnySmile

title: Improve user interface text to be clearer and more concise
body:
Improvements have been made to several user interface elements.

- Fixed various grammar and spelling errors
- Improved clarity of labels and tooltips
- General user interface clean up to standardise user experience
author: Kurylenko1

comments.body: you seem to know what you're doing so i hope changing the language code names isnt messing up the dictionary lookup at all.
I've only changed the displayed string for the languages. If there are issues, it should simply be reverted.

title: fixed puppeteer bracket parsing
body: changing these two lines fixes parsing brackets in puppeteer commands, which weren't registered previously
